name: Ytaj
detail: City of the Aspects

name: Naharja
detail: Tehrmari city that parties.

name: Aphelion
detail: Space Station, research vessel in orbit around Lo'Dahr.

name: Terminus
detail: Teleportation Space Station

name: Terminus
detail: Teleportation Center

name: Av'Sal
detail: Capital of the Avsohm Empire

name: Repository or whatever the name of the central place under Av'Sal is
detail: Main quest center, Mythbreaker hilt and reconstruction.

name: Stasis Facility
detail: A hidden research facility. Spawn point.

name: Sal'Mevir
detail: A large Avsohmic science facility experimenting with stasis, advanced flight, and temporal mechanics.

name: Sal'Mevir
detail: Sal'Mevir remains even after everything else has been lost to time.

name: Exodus Citadel
detail: Blue Exodus military base. Forging location of Mythbreaker

name: The Foundry
detail: A Red Dawn facility to create arms and vehicles. It also did alchemical R&D on soldiers.

name: Ring Research Installation
detail: A hydroelectric facility turned research station used to study runic rings in Khive's domain.

name: Resupply Depot
detail: A small spaceport on a floating island in Rihelma's domain. Used to shuttle personnel between Lo'Dahr and the Aphelion and Terminus.

name: Inscription Complex
detail: Manufacturing outpost in Loe's Domain where primal catalysts were inscribed due to the very low temperatures.

name: Core Facility
detail: Entrance facility to the Numencore.

name: Numencore
detail: Facility built around the Numencore, a swirling orb of primal energy at the center of Lo'Dahr

name: Primal Energy Collection Facility
detail: Mt. Yavhlix facility for collecting primal energy used for the Avsohmic Empire.

name: Azimuth Labs
detail: Underground alchemical laboratory of Red Dawn. Contains the God Machine, a device to created to use primal energy to ascend Emperor Anyr.

name: Resonant Halls
detail: Beneath the Primary Collection Facility and involved in collecting primal energy and scientific study, it also contains the Resonant Eye

name: Administration Wing
detail: Admin access required, Beneath Av'Sal

name: Primal Caverns
detail: Resting place of Drehmal.

name: New Drabyel
detail: Town in Capital Valley.

name: Rhaverik Inn and Trading Post
detail: Trading post in the Great Heartwood

name: Rhaverik
detail: Town destroyed by sinkholes and tunnel collapses due to mining for scraps of rehntite by Insohm.

name: Goziak
detail: Town in North Heartwood

name: Kazzani
detail: Abandoned village at edge of North Heartwood and Mael's Desolation

name: Pillager Mining Town
detail: Pillagers in houses in Mael's Desolation with a mine.

name: Ossein
detail: Ossein, located at the epicenter of Mael's Desolation

name: Ossein Arena
detail: Ossein boss arena.

name: Tahva
detail: South of Mael's Desolation, a village of ships that can sail away when needed.

name: Port Solitude
detail: On the coast of Mael's Desolation, a town of villagers and friendly pillagers.

name: Espinor
detail: On the Eastern edge of Mael's Desolation, next to the bridge is all that remains of the Kingdom of Espinor.

name: Zovan
detail: On the Western edge of the Black Jungle, next to the bridge.

name: Vulteid
detail: The former spiritual heart of the Black Jungle and home to the Indomitable, a local militia.

name: Verrhys Statue
detail: Underground statue of Verrhys, Aspect of Silence.

name: Abandoned obsidian and blackstone town
detail: An abandoned town in the central Black Jungle, made up of obsidian and blackstone buildings with water and lava channels.

name: Library Island
detail: Island Library, with a compass.

name: Firteid
detail: City of Tides, capital of the Tidal Empire.

name: Kiln of Virtuo
detail: Virtuo's Island

name: Divination Facility
detail: A research site at the Kiln of Virtuo to study an anomalous object with divine properties in project ArkAngel.

name: Lajani
detail: A town of fertile lands in the bones of Noha

name: Tieruun Monastery
detail: A monastery to Virtuo with dark secrets.

name: Coven of Potentia
detail: An Insohmic castle on an island in the far East, where the Coven of Potentia preformed it experiments.

name: Sevick
detail: An isolated island in the East. The inhabitants fled after convincing themselves they were dying of pestilence.

name: Old Mossfield
detail: Former capital of the Order of Insohm and the largest city in Drehmari history.

name: The Insohmic Library
detail: Library of the Insohmic Council, all that remains of Old Mossfield.

name: Mossfield
detail: A seaside village once a large city.

name: Hovadchear Crater
detail: All that is left of Castle Hovadchear, the site that housed the Insohmic Council, before vanishing.

name: Insane Alchemist's House
detail: House of an insane Skeveraan alchemist that experimented on local villagers from Helmshire.

name: Sunhearth Saloon
detail: Abandoned Saloon on the Spearhead Forest coast.

name: Lily Meadows Inn
detail: Inn on a lake.

name: Grandma Ben's House
detail: Grandma Ben dies of thorns leaving her house and livestock behind.

name: Virsuhl
detail: The remnants of Virsuhl, of the Southern Empire of Vir.

name: Timberhearth Observatory & Museum
detail: Museum containing a variety of artifacts from across the world.

name: Abandoned Altar
detail: Former home of a lonely and paranoid plant grower.

name: Cliff Tower
detail: Home of the Solitary Southerner.

name: Frontier's Edge Gift Shop
detail: A shop in the middle of Grand Pike Canyon, serving adventurers and survivors.

name: Wokonori
detail: Ancient adobe cliff dwellings with lots of taihryte deep underground.

name: Shatterhorn Gulch Prison
detail: Prison used by the Insohmic Coalition.

name: Highfall
detail: Formerly wealthy town, but the Frostfang Disaster cause trade to drop.

name: Structure under Highfall Castle
detail: Old structure, possible Avsohmic and used for alchemy, deep under Highfall Castle.

name: Virmari Hero Crypt
detail: Burial place of a Virmari hero from the Deity Wars

name: Highfall Lighthouse
detail: A lighthouse.

name: Stone Circle
detail: A circle of standing stones.

name: Max & Ruby's House
detail: Bunny house.

name: Homli's Pass Tower
detail: A tower in Highfall looking at the pass into Faehrcyle.

name: Frozen Bite small town
detail: A small town on top of the shattered land of the Frozen Bite.

name: Shivering Pines Inn
detail: A tavern and lodge in the Frozen Bite with a surprising number of guests.

name: Nihilist's House
detail: A house belonging to the Nihilist who has been under Hightower castle and knows three were involved in Av'sohm's destruction.

name: Snowman
detail: A giant snowman.

name: Av'sohm Art Historian Lighthouse
detail: A lighthouse belonging to a Green Serpent Trade Guild sponsored art historian.

name: Underground Spider Tower
detail: A tower created by some kind of sentient spider species?

name: Faehrcyle  Mines
detail: Mine shafts and branch mining. Beware of spiders.

name: Faehrcyle Pillager Outpost
detail: Collection of igloos with a band of pillagers.

name: Lai Devotee's House
detail: A small house with a large fire.

name: Tahsgan House
detail: An abandoned building of the Tahsgan clan.

name: Grave of Frost
detail: Grave site of Homli Tahsgan, King of the North, Guardian of Snow.

name: Loeleyhn Church
detail: Church to Loeleyhn, Aspect of Snow.

name: Schlonko
detail: Small coastal town in the west of Faehrcyle.

name: Frozen House
detail: Abandoned house of someone with nothing.

name: Frozen Ship
detail: A ship has found itself stuck in the ice and been abandoned.

name: Nihilist's Maze
detail: Entrance to a dark maze.

name: Insohm Research Camp
detail: A camp on the slopes of Mt. Yavhlix where Insohm tried and failed to gain access past the door.

name: Mt. Yavhlix Entrance
detail: Building and the entrance to the Primary Collection Facility. Sealed and guarded by the Gatewatch.

name: Primal Energy Collection Facility
detail: Structure inside Mt. Yavhlix for collecting primal energy. Full of holes.

name: The Breach
detail: Sealed entrance to the Breach (Spiral Anomaly), the source of Avsohm's primal energy.

name: Resonant Eye
detail: The most complex catalyst ever created by Avsohm to communicate across the Spiral Anomaly.

name: Tethlaen
detail: The Ever-Fear, Lost to Nothing

name: Verukhtian Tower
detail: An ancient Verukhtian Tower refurbished into a 'Battle Pizzazzle' by Vikhtor Ohna.

name: Guarded pass between Veruhkt Plateau and Grand Pike Canyon
detail: The pass is guarded and blocked by a wooden wall.

name: Destroyed Priscilla House
detail: A destroyed wooden house, Priscilla remains.

name: Vir Fort
detail: A sturdy stone fort built by the Empire of Vir.

name: Old Highfall Gatehouse
detail: An old gatehouse used to keep Frozen Bite barbarians out of Highfall.

name: Cabin
detail: An isolated Blacksmith's home in Verhkut Plateau.

name: Altar of Insight
detail: A ruined tower formerly occupied by people who sought to reach Lo'Veruhkt.

name: Sal'Veruhkt
detail: Formerly Verukhaan, the capital of the Veruhkt Plateau. It was conquered bu Avsohm.

name: Xenoh's Grave
detail: Rosefather Xenoh's grave.

name: Azaim
detail: Town founded by Casain residents fleeing Mael's advances in the west. It was destroyed by Gendrik's Incursion.

name: Campsite
detail: A campsite of with three Drehmari in Akhlo'Rohma.

name: The Lost Cavern
detail: A cavern of rhentite Avsohm discovered, contributing to its fast growth.

name: Duspian Bridge
detail: A bridge connecting north and south Akhlo'Rohma guarded by undead Duspians.

name: Ancehl Castle
detail: Royal castle and origin of modern alchemical practices. Contains crypts that hold many secrets.

name: Marahza
detail: A small village with greenhouses and the Altar of Vauniklah.

name: Estpelli Vineyard
detail: A inn and vineyard in Akhlo'Rohma

name: Dusps
detail: Capital of the Kingdom of Dusps from before the Order of Insohm.

name: Red Dawn Transport Station
detail: Located beneath a sunken astral body, this facility leads to other Red Dawn locations.

name: Abandoned Tehrmari Town
detail: A town formerly inhabited by Tehrmari Wingmakers. It slowly died as travel to Drehmal became optional.

name: Tehrmari Temple
detail: High up in the Purity Peaks live Tehrmari and Scalebound Priests.

name: Drahbes
detail: A civilization from the early Second Avihm

name: Next to Drahbes
detail: A small village with homes in hills next to the ruins of Drahbes

name: Maelmari House
detail: A house with Maelmari Berserkers in Akhlo'Rohma.

name: Campsite
detail: A small campsite in a forest to the east of the Gulf of Drehmal

name: Abandoned Tower
detail: A tower on an island near the Gulf of Drehmal.

name: Mihkmari Controlled Bridge
detail: A guarded bridge between the central regions and Purity Peaks.

name: Hevhlak
detail: A farming and fishing town of Tehrmari in the Purity Peaks.

name: Underground Avsohmic Tower
detail: A tower of unknown purpose in an underground lake under a mountain in the Purity Peaks.

name: Solvei
detail: A small town between Capital Valley and Purity Peaks.

name: Helmshire
detail: A small town in Spearhead Forest. Villagers have mysteriously disappeared recently.

name: Castle Scarstone
detail: Used by the Order of Insohm as a base of operations, now it lies in disrepair.

name: Deigh's Tower
detail: Mihkmari base of operations in the Verdant Labyrinth, suspended above the water.

name: Tree Village
detail: A small village built vertically around a tall tree.

name: Jack Beanin's House
detail: A house with a fast skeleton in it.

name: Sahd Ship
detail: A ship from Sahd carrying precious cargo.

name: Morah
detail: A town up in the mountains of Sahd

name: 'The Path' Pagoda
detail: A tiered tower.

name: Runic Forge
detail: A powerful, runic forge in the caldera of a volcano.

name: Zedoh Clan Village
detail: Abandoned village of the Zedoh Clan.

name: Bell Temple
detail: Five bells. One for each fragment.

name: Estate
detail: A large estate. Attacked by outlaws, the lord cursed them to forever defend it.

name: Serpant Mural
detail: An ancient mural of a great serpant.

name: Sahd
detail: Capital of the Island of Sahd.

name: Destroyed Dahe Clan Village
detail: The flattened ruins of the Dahe Clan.

name: Underwood Village
detail: Village at the entrance to the Underwood.

name: Beast's Den
detail: A tower at the center of the Underwood to Greatbeast Muhs, the Aspect of Beasts. Guarded by Templars of the Beast.

name: Overgrown Heartwood House
detail: An abandoned house in the Heartwood.

name: Overgrown Structure
detail: An overgrown, pyramid like structure to the North of the Heartwood.

name: Insohmic Research Center
detail: A center for studying Avsohmic artefacts, tyring to unlock the Empire's technological secrets.

name: The Fool's Home
detail: A damaged, solitary home.

name: Ihted
detail: A city of runic magic and Khive worship from before Avsohm. It has slowly sunk into the ground.

name: Hunter's Crypt
detail: Crypt of three hunters.

name: Thesund
detail: A small village overlooking a lake that has seeks to live without primal catalysts. May have been founded by teenagers?

name: Drehn's Castle
detail: A castle overlooking Av'Sal where Drehn was raised.

name: Av'Sal Scavengers House
detail: A house with three scavengers on the outskirts of Av'Sal.

name: Friendly Fellow's Humble Abode
detail: The Funny Man is inside.

name: Drehuan Sculptures and Ruins
detail: Collection of large Drehuan sculptures and ruins from before Av'Sal.

name: Watchtower
detail: A watchtower overlooking the lake with no easy access.

name: Drehua Temple
detail: A large temple to Drehmal in the Palisade's Heath.

name: The Whale's Tale
detail: A boat turned tavern and inn.

name: Palisade's Heath Catacombs
detail: Catacombs build halfway up the cliff wall.

name: Abandoned Seaside town
detail: Abandoned Avsohmic town on the coast with a strange underground room.

name: Zack's Hut of Shame
detail: A simple dirt hut.

name: Mohta
detail: Major town of Lorahn'Kahl.

name: Moonlight Sanctum
detail: Underground dungeon where the Tri-Moon Theocracy raised a massive army of the undead using the Necrotic Engine.

name: Eloa
detail: Town in the forests of Lorahn'Kahl. Abandoned after the collapse of Insohm and the return of the Maelmari and a Burnt General.

name: Ayre Family House
detail: Abandoned house of the Ayre family located outside of Eloa. The family fled east to escape the Maelmari, leaving behind many of their belongings.

name: Sal'Loran
detail: City previously inhabited by supporters of the Tri-Moon Theocracy.

name: Tri-Moon Theocracy Meeting Hall
detail: Located beneath the remains of a skull beast, necromancers and alchemists of the Tri-Moon Theocracy met for the last time.

name: Slime Island
detail: An inland island made up of green slime.

name: Semehol
detail: The town was destroyed and occupied by Maelmari after the residents rose up against the Third Burnt General.

name: Ohmswil's Emporium'
detail: Home of Master Arcanist Ohmswil who sells rare and unusual items.

name: Campsite on Floating Island
detail: A single campsite on a floating island near the Gulf of Drehmal

name: Fortahn
detail: Ruins of an Avsohmic city on the coast of the Gulf of Drehmal. It's leaders vanished and others torn to shreds by the monster that destroyed the empire.

name: ICS Arbiter
detail: The Order of Insohm only remaining airship. Built using designs of Mael's airships and Avsohmic technology.

name: Loe Village (Kamt?)
detail: A small town that worshiped Loe, on the coast of the Gulf of Drehmal.

name: Arijool Forks
detail: A collection of ancient structures build into the ground. Possibly a meeting place for the Mekta tribe.

name: Maelmari Cliff Outpost
detail: A small Maelmari outpost in Merijool.

name: Primal Sapling
detail: A giant tree deep in the forest of Merijool.

name: Okeke
detail: A peaceful town in Merijool.

name: Coal Mine
detail: A small coal mine in Merijool.

name: Merijool Unification Shrine
detail: A shrine celebrating the unification of Merijool between Loe and Lai followers, ending centuries of conflict.

name: Sunken ruins
detail: Sunken ruins of a Drehmal worshiping town in Merijool.

name: Sacred Flame Temple
detail: Temple to Lai, Aspect of Warmth. Its flame has gone out.

name: Campsite
detail: A campsite on a volcanic island between Merijool and Casai.

name: Butte Mine
detail: A mine inside the butte's of Casai.

name: Arhrah
detail: On the northern shore of Lake Athrah, the city was founded in Av2 and was the center of the Casain Empire.

name: Sal'Lohd
detail: Once premier port in Casai.

name: House with tower
detail: A house on the western edge of Merijool.

name: Campsite
detail: A miners campsite in east Casai.

name: Maelmari Watchtower
detail: A wooden tower with Maelmari on the last island in Northwest Casai.

name: Avsohmic Vault
detail: A vault of knowledge created by Avsohm primarily to store information about primal energy and the collection facility. Master Ultva of the Order of Insohm was driven insane by what he learned here.

name: Perishing Well
detail: An altar to Voynahla and a crypt.

name: Zarha
detail: A town previously inhabited by the Zarha tribe of southern Casai. A building of Chieftain's Kazabar favored art still remains.

name: Maerhn'Vos
detail: A great wall created by the Tharhan Empire in the time before Avsohm. It was used to secure the lands to the south, stopping Casain and Merijool invaders.

name: Tharxax City
detail: Originally the Tharhan capitol of Elthun, Tharxax City is now under the control of Maelihs, paying taxes to remain 'free'.

name: Loraga Keep
detail: A castle in the former province of Loraga.

name: John Brinn Thinn Estate
detail: An abandoned house in South Tharxax.

name: Tharxax House
detail: A large, staffed house in east Tharxax. Possibly a nobles house.

name: Maelmari Camp
detail: A Maelmari base in central Tharxax to asset control over the area.

name: Fort Nihmaj
detail: A well defended castle-town that continues to resist Maelihs.

name: Avshom Kohlohmah
detail: Crashed Avsohmic flying machine. Its pilot likely escaped from Sal'Anyr to Fort Nihmaj.

name: Homesick Tergei's Camp
detail: He's a long way from Mohta.

name: Ezahn Family Residence
detail: Unknown empty building at the north end of Tharxax.

name: Mihkmari Camp
detail: Mihkmari tree camp.

name: Caer Adacia
detail: Ancient underground city and capital of the Second Tharhan Empire until Avsohm then Maelihs then Insohm the ruin.

name: Giant Jack'o'Lantern
detail: A giant glowing pumpkin surrounded by smaller pumpkins.

name: Bone Excavation Site
detail: A dig site uncovering a large skeleton.

name: Maelmari House
detail: A house complex with Maelmari Berserkers in the Ebony Veldt.

name: Maelmari tower fort
detail: A small fort built around the Ebony Veldt tower.

name: Seylon Klemelli House
detail: Seylon Klemelli traveled to the Ebony Veldt every year to harvest Paroto roots.

name: Avsohm Gatehouse
detail: An abandoned gatehouse between Casai and Mt Ebonfire.

name: Avsohm Tunnel
detail: An old tunnel from The Foundry, through the mountains around Mt. Ebonfire.

name: Foundry Access Tower
detail: A security tower for the Foundry.

name: Foundry Access Tower
detail: A security tower for the Foundry.

name: Foundry Access Tower
detail: A security tower for the Foundry.

name: Elvett?
detail: A town in the shadows of a giant Avsohmic bridge.

name: Temple to Lailoehn
detail: A temple to Lailoehn, Aspect of Fire, child of Lai.

name: Camp
detail: An abandoned camp south east of Mt. Ebonfire.

name: Mt. Ebonfire Mine
detail: The entrance to the mines inside Mt. Ebonfire.

name: Ebonrun Tunnel
detail: A tunnel through the clifs for workers between Ebonrun and Mt. Ebonfire.

name: Ebonrun
detail: A town enslaved to work the mines by Maelihs.

name: Ebonrun Dam
detail: A missive dam controlled by Maelmari. It also keeps in the villagers.

name: Avsohmic Launch Zone
detail: A site for launching and docking Avsohmic airships.

name: Jungle City Ruins
detail: A long abandoned city of red sandstone, possibly Casian.

name: Ocean Spire House
detail: A house high up on a stone pillar off the west coast.

name: Solitary Fisherman's House
detail: A house of kelp and straw  with a single fisherman.

name: Blackstone tower
detail: A tower of blackstone overlooking the coast and islands.

name: Desert Blacksmith's House
detail: A nice house in the desert near Sal'Anyr. The blacksmith is the daughter of a talented Insohm smith.

name: Temple of Dahroehl
detail: Temple to the Water-Wyrm Dahroehl, Aspect of Freshwater, child of Dahr.

name: Sal'Anyr Spelunker House
detail: An unlucky spelunker's house at the base of Sal'Anyr.

name: Sal'Anyr
detail: A great military city of Avsohm under the control of House Anyr. It fell to a skullbeast in a day at the end of Avsohm and start of the Dune Wars. It was previously known as Azen'nath.

name: Missile Silo
detail: Powerful weapons of Avsohm lay buried in the sands.

name: The Vault
detail: Blue Exodus storage and research center for Avsohm's military equipment.

name: Witch's Tower
detail: A witch's tower overlooking Nihmaj Swamp.

name: Crashed Avsohmic Ship
detail: An old crashed cargo airship.

name: Avshomic Lifeboat
detail: A crashed lifeboat from an airship. There were no survivors.

name: Maelmari Camp
detail: A Maelmari base near the Ebony Veldt.

name: Crashed Steamboat
detail: A crashed boat on the banks of the river south of Fort Nihmaj.

name: Crashed Steamboat
detail: A crashed boat on the banks of the river south of Fort Nihmaj.

name: Abandoned Swamp Hut
detail: An abandoned hut in the middle of a glowberry cave.

name: Tharhan Swamp Castle
detail: A castle in Nihmaj Swamp built by a Lady who would not submit to Maelihs.

name: Nihmaj Alchemical Castle
detail: A run down castle full of Mikhmari and Alchemist trying to achieve The Great Work.

name: Carmine Town Ruins
detail: Ruins of a town at the far north of the Carmine.

name: Campsite
detail: A campsite on the edge of the Carmine.

name: Maelmari Lookout Fort
detail: A lookout tower and building to keep watch and provide warning to Rhaveloth.

name: Birthing Grounds Growth
detail: A fleshy growth that extends deep into the birthing grounds. It may have been an attempt to recreate a skull beast or the Mother.

name: Birthing Grounds Skull
detail: A strange structure inside a skull at the end of the Birthing Grounds.

name: Sarlac Pit
detail: It does not like sand either.

name: Rhaveloth
detail: The chaotic, many leveled city of the Maelmari.

name: Sepulchral Altar
detail: A massive amphitheater and altar for Maelihs.

name: Zombie Pigman Hamlet
detail: A collection of small houses and zombie pigmen.

name: Titans of Strength and Servitude
detail: Giant statues at the entrance of the Hellcrags.

name: The Burnt Palace
detail: The Throne of Maelhis in the center of the Hellcrags.

name: Insohmic Port
detail: A port on the south side of the Island of Dusk.

name: Coastal Tower
detail: A tower with a single Drehmari.

name: Coven of Koh
detail: A coven of Drehmari in underground tunnels worshiping Koh, Aspect of Stone.

name: Coastal Tower
detail: A tower with a single Drehamri.

name: Mendarum Crystal Mine
detail: A mine to collect mendarum crystals, useful for runic magic.

name: Xorhuul
detail: Underground town of the Xorhai, descendants of the Clan Xorha Barbarians who were exiled by the Casian Empire.

name: Campsite
detail: A small campsite on the Island of Dawn.

name: Star-rise Bastion
detail: Originally a temple to Virtuo, after the Goddess left, the Virmari encountered Rihelma, Aspect of the Sky.

name: Docks
detail: Docks on the Island of Dawn to ship crystals.

name: Explorer's Campsite
detail: Campsite of an explorer.

name: Ultva and Hovadchear
detail: Masters of the Order of Insohm.

name: The Emissary
detail: Waiting to see the end of Avsohm since its beginning.

name: Astorahnni Tower
detail: Followers of the Torahn, the heavenly body, banished from Merijool.

name: Mt. Yavhlix Entrance
detail: Entrance to Mt. Yavhlix facility.

name: Completion Room
detail: Room after beating the game.

name: Spawn Room
detail: Room before starting the game

name: Augural Tangle
detail: Crystal cavern revealing refractions of other worlds as seen by Rihelma.

name: Oriann's Tomb
detail: Crystal tomb of Dragonrider Oriann, a mortal Ro'Tehrmari who was the only being to understand the Star-Rise Drake, Rihelma.

name: Up House
detail: House from Up, the movie.

name: Star-Rise Orrery
detail: Rihelma checks your perception.

name: Slate House
detail: Craftsman's house of made of slate in Noha's domain.

name: Destroyed slate town
detail: Remnant's of a town in Noha's domain.

name: Moondonalds
detail: Way out in the wastes.

name: Adventurine Dome
detail: An adventurine house inside a glass dome.

name: Campsite
detail: A campsite near an Avsohmic pad.

name: Avsohmic Landing Pad
detail: An Avsohmic landing pad that used to be connected to a larger base.

name: Orrery
detail: An orrery and house in Rihelma's domain.

name: Temple of Voynahla
detail: A temple to Voynahla, Aspect of Death, who killed himself but did not truly die.

name: Ro'Tehrmari Cave
detail: A cave of Ro'Tehrmari.

name: Spider Cave
detail: A cave poisonous spiders in Voynahla's Domain.

name: Arkeje? or Rohei?
detail: A town overlooking Voynahla's Domain.

name: Rihanar
detail: A town of craftsmen and third largest habitation before the Schism when all inhabitants disappeared suddenly.

name: Floating Temple to the Tempests
detail: A temple marking the burial site to the three Tempests, Durias, Estehl, and Amohn Aihura.

name: Damaged building
detail: A building beneath the corpse of the lightning dragon in Palaesida's domain

name: Heart of the Storm
detail: The remains of the Aspect of Storms, the Tempest, Palaesida.

name: Okhran Prison
detail: Floating prison in Palaesida's domain.

name: Kungahs's Cage
detail: Prison cage for Kungahs, the Hateful Blade.

name: Hypogean Labyrinth
detail: Nahyn evaluates your composure.

name: Crystal Cavern
detail: A cavern of large crystals with a spike of amethyst at the center.

name: Miner's house
detail: A house belonging to a amethyst miner.

name: Forest Watchtower
detail: A wooden tower to watch over the forest.

name: Ice Pond House
detail: A house over a mine in a frozen pond.

name: Roheian Castle
detail: Center of the Roheian Empire in the Free Lands.

name: Coven of Alchemists
detail: A castle of alchemists in Maen's domain where they studied the primal emotions: Pain, Pleasure, & Fear.

name: Magic Practitioner's Fort
detail: A small fort who's inhabitant studied magic.

name: Sword Bridge
detail: A massive sword acts as a bridge between Vayniklah's and Moen's domains.

name: Lopaja Town
detail: A small town in mushrooms in Lahr's domain

name: Brightwyrm's Caldarium
detail: Lai assays your ingenuity.

name: Brulante Residence
detail: The residence of the Brulante clan, Tehrmari pyromancers who wield a unique and powerful flame known only to them.

name: Tehrmari Metalworkers
detail: A small enclave of Tehrmari metalworkers in Lai's Domain.
